text:
You use ChatGPT daily, but you never set it up. 

Here's how to do it (the right way):

1. Custom Instructions 
→ This is context.

You’re telling ChatGPT who you are, what you care about, how you work, etc.

Example fills:
“I run a weekly newsletter about marketing & AI.”
“My audience is founders and solo creators.”

The more you share, the more ChatGPT tailors answers to your workflow.

2. Enable Memory 
→ This is where ChatGPT gets scary good.

Go to:
1. Settings.
2. Personalization.
3. Memory → Turn ON

What happens next? ChatGPT remembers your name, your tone, your projects, your goals. 

Next time you say “Remember the article we wrote last week about [X]? I want the same style."

Bonus: You can see, edit, or delete anything it remembers. Total control.

Master AI with words (not code) → how-to-ai.guide
